alert.note: Alert for Banner; Cheyenne; Kimball; Morrill; Scotts Bluff (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 5:25PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Scotts Bluff, northwestern Cheyenne, north central Kimball, southwestern Morrill and eastern Banner Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 425 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Harrisburg, or 13 miles north of Kimball, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chimney Rock State Park, Redington, South Bayard Junction and Harrisburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Banner; Cheyenne; Kimball; Morrill; Scotts Bluff
